item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 19th, 2019: Shoot the Moon
item.description: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing with music about Space in this session of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of the Apollo 11 moon landing with music about Space in this session of Bridging the Gap.

item.title: Bridging the Gap July 18th ~ Moon Mania
item.description: This week we're commemorating the 50th Aniversary of the Lunar Landing. More specifically, here on Bridging the Gap, we'll be playing nothing but moon-related songs and tracks. Believe it or not, plenty of artists have at least one moon-related song.
item.itunes:summary: This week we're commemorating the 50th Aniversary of the Lunar Landing. More specifically, here on Bridging the Gap, we'll be playing nothing but moon-related songs and tracks. Believe it or not, plenty of artists have at least one moon-related song.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 17th, 2019: All Women, Lots of Color
item.description: This session of Bridging the Gap is entirely made of female artists from the states. The idea was to showcase the diversity of sound in this country... but it's going to lean heavily on Soul and a little Gospel.
item.itunes:summary: This session of Bridging the Gap is entirely made of female artists from the states. The idea was to showcase the diversity of sound in this country... but it's going to lean heavily on Soul and a little Gospel.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 16th, 2019: Nā Kani o ka ʻĀina
item.description: "Nā Kani o ka ʻĀina" literally translates to "The Sounds of the Land", but metaphorically alludes to the many melodic and harmonic voices that have come out of Hawaiian music. Much like the multitudes of sounds in nature, such are the voices of this land. Throughout the generations a wide variety of Hawaiian music has been produced - from ancient chants to the modern contemporary mele of today. DJ Mermaid explores the different sounds and styles of Hawaiian music on tonight's edition of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: "Nā Kani o ka ʻĀina" literally translates to "The Sounds of the Land", but metaphorically alludes to the many melodic and harmonic voices that have come out of Hawaiian music. Much like the multitudes of sounds in nature, such are the voices of this land. Throughout the generations a wide variety of Hawaiian music has been produced - from ancient chants to the modern contemporary mele of today. DJ Mermaid explores the different sounds and styles of Hawaiian music on tonight's edition of Bridging the Gap.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 15th, 2019: Monday Evening Chill
item.description: Moody and Mellow music makes up this session of Bridging the Gap with bits of Bossa Nova, Fado, Soul and Downtempo.
item.itunes:summary: Moody and Mellow music makes up this session of Bridging the Gap with bits of Bossa Nova, Fado, Soul and Downtempo.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 12th, 2019: Friday Night Free-For-All
item.description: Following up last night's session of Bridging the Gap with Harrison Patiño and his Free-For-All show with another eclectic night of music. Expect a little Boogaloo, Psychedelic Rock, Soul, Dub and more.
item.itunes:summary: Following up last night's session of Bridging the Gap with Harrison Patiño and his Free-For-All show with another eclectic night of music. Expect a little Boogaloo, Psychedelic Rock, Soul, Dub and more.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ July 11th: Thursday Night Free For All
item.description: Sometimes the best plan is no plan at all. HPR's Harrison Patino proves that with tonight's Bridging the Gap, where he goes down the musical rabbit hole - exploring jazz, world music, indie rock, soul and even a few new releases to boot. Expect the unexpected.
item.itunes:summary: Sometimes the best plan is no plan at all. HPR's Harrison Patino proves that with tonight's Bridging the Gap, where he goes down the musical rabbit hole - exploring jazz, world music, indie rock, soul and even a few new releases to boot. Expect the unexpected.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 10th, 2019: New Sound
item.description: Back on track and exploring new releases in this session of Bridging the Gap. Expect new music from Austin's Black Pumas, Ty Segall, and Quantic (pictured).
item.itunes:summary: Back on track and exploring new releases in this session of Bridging the Gap. Expect new music from Austin's Black Pumas, Ty Segall, and Quantic (pictured).

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 8th, 2019: Summer Beach Vibes
item.description:
A collection of island-inspired summer beach vibes. An ecclectic mix of reggae, ska, indie-electro, and rock. Perfect for a hot, summer day, lying on the beach. Some of the local tracks are songs that DJ Mermaid grew up with, including the Hawaiian Style Band, who's hosting our upcoming Talk Story event with members of the original Hawaiian Style Band.
Get your tickets to the Hawaiian Style Band Talk Story event at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hawaiian-style-band-talk-story-event-tickets-63835665193

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 8th, 2019: 6 Year Anniversary (Part 2)
item.description: This past Saturday marked the 6th year anniversary of Bridging the Gap on Hawaii Public Radio. So I'm putting together part 2 of best of the show from the last 6 years, and sticking to the mellower side of the show for this Monday evening. We'll also be paying tribute to Bossa Nova founder João Gilberto who passed away on Saturday at 88.
item.itunes:summary: This past Saturday marked the 6th year anniversary of Bridging the Gap on Hawaii Public Radio. So I'm putting together part 2 of best of the show from the last 6 years, and sticking to the mellower side of the show for this Monday evening. We'll also be paying tribute to Bossa Nova founder João Gilberto who passed away on Saturday at 88.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 5th, 2019: 6 Year Anniversary
item.description: Tomorrow (Saturday) is the 6th year anniversary of Bridging the Gap on Hawaii Public Radio. So I'm putting together a best of the show from the last 6 years.
item.itunes:summary: Tomorrow (Saturday) is the 6th year anniversary of Bridging the Gap on Hawaii Public Radio. So I'm putting together a best of the show from the last 6 years.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 3rd, 2019: An Early 4th
item.description: Celebrating an early 4th of July! I'm marking the occasion with songs about American immigrant stories, political struggles, freedom, and a few protest songs... just to remind us that we're from a country of immigrants and free thinking radicals.
item.itunes:summary: Celebrating an early 4th of July! I'm marking the occasion with songs about American immigrant stories, political struggles, freedom, and a few protest songs... just to remind us that we're from a country of immigrants and free thinking radicals.

item.title: Bridging The Gap~July 2nd, 2019: Sounds from Aotearoa
item.description:
DJ Mermaid comes back to us from a week in Aotearoa (New Zealand) full of mahalo for the tangata whenua (peope of the land) that hosted her so well. Tonight's episode of Bridging The Gap honors the people, places, and language of Aotearoa through the waiata (songs) that the whanau (family) shared with her, along with other music she heard during her time there. From contemporary to more traditional songs, DJ Mermaid takes us along with her on her journey from the opening waiata "Aotearoa" by a collective of contemporary Maori musicians, pays homage to the vibrancy of te reo Māori with the crowd favorite "Whakatō te Kākano", then visits Mokoia Island in Lake Rotorua through the telling the forbidden love story of Hinemoa and Tūtānekai in "Pōkarekare Ana".
Featuring Maori artists like Maisey Rika, Whirimako Black, Stan Walker, Rob Ruha, Uru Whetu, the Patea Maori Club, and so many more, tonight's show is not to be missed.
item.itunes:summary:
DJ Mermaid comes back to us from a week in Aotearoa (New Zealand) full of mahalo for the tangata whenua (peope of the land) that hosted her so well. Tonight's episode of Bridging The Gap honors the people, places, and language of Aotearoa through the waiata (songs) that the whanau (family) shared with her, along with other music she heard during her time there. From contemporary to more traditional songs, DJ Mermaid takes us along with her on her journey from the opening waiata "Aotearoa" by a collective of contemporary Maori musicians, pays homage to the vibrancy of te reo Māori with the crowd favorite "Whakatō te Kākano", then visits Mokoia Island in Lake Rotorua through the telling the forbidden love story of Hinemoa and Tūtānekai in "Pōkarekare Ana".
Featuring Maori artists like Maisey Rika, Whirimako Black, Stan Walker, Rob Ruha, Uru Whetu, the Patea Maori Club, and so many more, tonight's show is not to be missed.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ July 4th: Early Influential American Music
item.description: To ring in this year's Fourth of July, Harrison Patino explores influential tracks of early folk, blues, bluegrass and gospel music that had a profound impact on the larger soundscapes of what can be called "American Music." Songs of labor, strife, belief and protest from turbulent times in the country's history on an atypically patriotic edition of Bridging the Gap.
item.itunes:summary: To ring in this year's Fourth of July, Harrison Patino explores influential tracks of early folk, blues, bluegrass and gospel music that had a profound impact on the larger soundscapes of what can be called "American Music." Songs of labor, strife, belief and protest from turbulent times in the country's history on an atypically patriotic edition of Bridging the Gap.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~July 1st, 2019: Downtempo Delights
item.description: Since Monday always seems like a good time for more mellow selections... I'm filling the late night airwaves with chilled beats and sophisticated Jazz.
item.itunes:summary: Since Monday always seems like a good time for more mellow selections... I'm filling the late night airwaves with chilled beats and sophisticated Jazz.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~June 28th, 2019: Sun Kissed
item.description: Since the weather is still hot and muggy (thought it's supposed to clear up) and since it's now officially summertime, this session of Bridging the Gap is going to be packed with sunshine filled songs.
item.itunes:summary: Since the weather is still hot and muggy (thought it's supposed to clear up) and since it's now officially summertime, this session of Bridging the Gap is going to be packed with sunshine filled songs.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ June 27th, 2019: Dave Bartholomew Tribute
item.description: For tonight's Bridging the Gap, another tribute to a New Orleans legend. Bandleader Dave Bartholomew - an early pioneer of Rhythm & Blues and Rock & Roll - passed away this Sunday at the age of 100. To pay homage, Harrison Patino plays some of his best tracks, along with some of the music of his contemporaries that he so deeply influenced.
item.itunes:summary: For tonight's Bridging the Gap, another tribute to a New Orleans legend. Bandleader Dave Bartholomew - an early pioneer of Rhythm & Blues and Rock & Roll - passed away this Sunday at the age of 100. To pay homage, Harrison Patino plays some of his best tracks, along with some of the music of his contemporaries that he so deeply influenced.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~June 26th, 2019: Jazzy and Random
item.description: This session of Bridging the Gap is going to be a little random... about as random as the cat meme that's pictured. I'm trying to weave together a little Jazz, a little afro-funk, and a little indie rock into the next two hours... because why not listen to good music... why not make memes out of stuffed Persian cat.
item.itunes:summary: This session of Bridging the Gap is going to be a little random... about as random as the cat meme that's pictured. I'm trying to weave together a little Jazz, a little afro-funk, and a little indie rock into the next two hours... because why not listen to good music... why not make memes out of stuffed Persian cat.

item.title: Bridging the Gap~June 25th, 2019: On Repeat
item.description: Tonight's episode of Bridging The Gap consists of songs DJ Mermaid has had on repeat. Being an obsessive listener, she's got a playlist full of songs that are so good she's had them on repeat for days, weeks, sometimes even months.
item.itunes:summary: Tonight's episode of Bridging The Gap consists of songs DJ Mermaid has had on repeat. Being an obsessive listener, she's got a playlist full of songs that are so good she's had them on repeat for days, weeks, sometimes even months.

item.title: Bridging the Gap ~ June 24th, 2019: New Jazz and Then Some
item.description: This show started as a buffet of new Jazz releases... but morphed into a variety of Jazz, Americana, Latin and more. We're starting off with new music from Quantic (pictured DJing live in Honolulu a few years ago).
item.itunes:summary: This show started as a buffet of new Jazz releases... but morphed into a variety of Jazz, Americana, Latin and more. We're starting off with new music from Quantic (pictured DJing live in Honolulu a few years ago).
